results.title: Volleyball Training Video-Olympics `84
results.brief_description: This video shows the different skills involved in volleyball as demonstrated by the champion players of the 1984 Olympics. Each skill is shown clearly in slow motion. An excellent training video for volleyball enthusiasts.

results.title: Volleyball for boys
results.brief_description: Rules of the game and modifications made to adopt it to local conditions are shown. Detailed instruction is given on serving, volleying, spiking and defensive play. Class drills for the perfection of skills as well as actual game play are also shown.

results.title: Volleyball for beginners. Part one. The game
results.creator_credit: Sports Films, Brian M. Williams and Alan Simpson
results.brief_description: Comments on the rise in popularity of volleyball since it became an Olympic sport. The National Volleyball Team demonstrates the basic techniques: positions on court, volleying, heading practice, service, receiving and spiking. The importance of teamwork and drills for improving reactions are shown and a short game is played.

results.title: Volere volare
results.creator_credit: Bambu, Penta Films, Ernesto di Sarro, Mario Cecchi Gori, Vittorio Cecchi Gori, Maurizio Nichetti and Guido Manuli
results.brief_description: This decidedly offbeat romantic comedy starring and directed by Maurizio Nichetti (The Icicle thief) blends live-action with animation. Nichetti plays a bumbling sound technician who combs Milan in search of interesting sounds which he uses when dubbing vintage Disney cartoons with new Italian-language soundtracks. One day he meets Martina (Angela Finocchiaro), a call-girl with a kinky clientele, who like Maurizio, is completely absorbed in catering to the fantasies and illusions of others. Both hopelessly romantic and lonely, they begin a relationship. Yet just as love is blossoming Maurizo’s body undergoes a strange transformation - his hands change from human flesh to bright yellow animation. Eventually he becomes completely animated while remaining true to his flesh and blood self, a development that does wonders for the couple’s relationship. Totally unpredictable and consistently witty, this movie features highly inventive visual gags. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Volcanoes: exploring the restless earth
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Bert Van Bork
results.brief_description: On-location photography and animated drawings illustrate volcanic phenomena in Hawaii, Mexico, Italy and Iceland. The film distinguishes shield, cinder cone and strato-volcano by showing how each type of volcano is formed and how each erupts. Before and after footage of the 1973 destruction of Helgarfjell on Iceland’s Heimaey Island vividly documents the effect of volcanic eruptions on man and his environment. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Volcanoes, earthquakes, and other earth movements
results.creator_credit: Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions and Reinald Werrenrath Jr
results.brief_description: Indicates that volcanoes and earthquakes are evidence of a natural process called plate tectonics. Shows how to chart part movements of these crustal plates and how to make predictions about their movements. The program also uses excellent location film such as the eruption of the Mt St Helens volcano in Norther America. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Volcano: an inquiry into the life and death of Malcolm Lowry
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Donald Brittain, Robert Duncan, James de B. Domville and John Kramer
results.brief_description: Author of one of the major novels of the century, Under the Volcano, Malcolm Lowry fought a winning battle with words, and a losing battle with liquor. On-location shooting in four countries, photographs, readings by Richard Burton from Lowry’s novel, and interviews with the people who loved and hated him give the film a terrifying immediacy. More than a portrait, it is a reflection on the greater agony of man. (10 awards including: Asolo; Toronto; Oscar nomination, Hollywood.)

results.title: Volcano
results.creator_credit: University of California, Los Angeles and Alan Probert
results.brief_description: Describes the growth of the volcano Paricutin, which rose suddenly in central Mexico. Sequences cover the volcano’s first eruption in 1943, and its sturdy growth since that time. Shows water vapor, rocks, molten lava, the throat of the cone, and some of the devastation wrought in nearby areas by the slow crushing advance of the lava flow.

results.title: Volcano
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Television, Gail Willumsen and Teresa Koenig
results.brief_description: A detailed documentary on the force and ferocity behind some of the earth’s 1,500 potentially dangerous volcanoes, and the threat they pose to those who live within their reach. Elaborates on some of the more famous volcanoes and eruptions, including Galeras (Colombia), Kilauea (Hawaii), Sakurajima and Unzen (Japan), and Pinatubo (Philippines), using archival footage to show the raw power behind these incredible acts of creation. The experiences of vulcanologists Stanley Williams and Maurice and Katia Krafft are also explored, as are the after-effects of an eruption, volcanoes in history, and current methods of detection and evacuation.
